title: About Biome
content: Biome was born out of the desire for a free and open source distribution of Chef Habitat™. This distribution shares the same codebase, but is not backed by or supported by Chef Software Inc.

title: Introduction
content:
Get an introduction to Biome installation, usage in the following pages:
 About Biome   Installation

title: Installation
content:
Biome is distributed as a standalone portable binary for various platforms. Initial installation is as simple as downloading that binary and installing in your path.
Download the latest release from the Github Releases Page for your platform.
Example (MacOS):
# Download the binary $ wget https://github.com/biome-sh/biome/releases/download/bio-0.83.0/bio-0.83.0-x86_64-darwin # Rename to 'bio' $ mv bio-0.83.0-x86_64-darwin /usr/local/bin/bio $ chmod +x /usr/local/bin/bio  You can now run bio:
$ bio --version bio 0.83.0

title: Contributing
content:
Interested in contributing to the Biome source code, community or documentation? We’d love to hear from you!
Here are the best ways to get in touch:
 Submit an issue on Github Submit a pull request on Github Tweet to us @biome_sh  We’re also really interested to receive support for translating the site. Check the link at the top right of every page to edit, and submit pull requests directly on Github.

Biome is a community distribution of Chef Habitat™ released under the Apache-2.0 license. No restrictions, no commercial licensing, and no cost. Free to use for anyone for personal or commercial purposes. Biome was forked from the Chef Habitat™ project to create a open source and free to use distribution following Chefâ€™s guidelines.
